info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 17 at 6:57PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect now until 6 AM Friday... * WHAT...Avalanche warning. The avalanche danger is HIGH. Heavy snowfall and strong wind are overloading a very weak snowpack. * WHERE...The southern Salmon River, Sawtooth, western Smoky, Smoky, White Cloud, Boulder, Pioneer, and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains surrounding Banner Summit, Stanley, Smiley Creek, Atlanta, Galena Summit, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche warning does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect from Wednesday 6 PM MST to Friday 6 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are very likely to occur. Very large avalanches large enough to destroy houses may occur. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Stay off of and out from below steep slopes - slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may be triggered remotely - from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
